duck: Symptomatic treatment - Symptomatic treatment is any medical therapy of a disease that only affects its symptoms, not its cause, i.e., its etiology.
Symptoms (film) - Symptoms is a 1974 British horror film directed by José Ramón Larraz.
symptom definition: subjective evidence of disease or physical disturbance; '''broadly'''.
Pathogenesis - The pathogenesis of a disease is the mechanism that causes the disease.

A symptom (from Greek σύμπτωμα, "accident, misfortune, that which befalls", from συμπίπτω, "I befall", from συν- "together, with" + πίπτω, "I fall") is a departure from normal function or feeling which is noticed by a patient, indicating the presence of disease or abnormality.

wiki.text:
A 'symptom' (from Greek σύμπτωμα, "accident, misfortune, that which
befalls",<ref></ref> from συμπίπτω, "I befall", from συν- "together, with" +
πίπτω, "I fall") is a departure from normal function or feeling which is noticed
by a patient, indicating the presence of disease or abnormality. A symptom is
subjective,<ref>[http://www.uwo.ca/pathol/glossary.html#S Pathology -
Glossary]</ref> observed by the
patient,<ref>[http://www.emedicine.com/asp/dictionary.asp?keyword=symptom
eMedicine/Stedman Medical Dictionary Lookup!]</ref> and cannot be measured
directly.<ref name="pmid1479160"></ref>

The term is sometimes also applied to physiological states outside the context
of disease, as for example when referring to "symptoms of pregnancy".
wiki.title: symptom
